intro: Cryosophila nana, commonly known as the dwarf snowbell, is a small flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and is adapted to cold climates with short growing seasons. Its flowers are white or pale blue, and it produces small, round fruits. Cryosophila nana plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its environment, supporting pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of polar ecosystems.
